column1: vf:UnsupportedTagsInHtml5Check,Tags No Longer Supported in HTML5 Should Not Be Used,"&lt
The following tags are no longer supported in HTML5 and should not be used:
More information on deprecated tags is avaliable here - https://www.tutorialspoint.com/html5/html5_deprecated_tags.htm

column5: //Good: The size of the text should now be specified in CSS.

column1: vf:AvoidHtmlCommentCheck,Avoid HTML Comments,"Checks for occurrence of HTML comments on server side pages.
HTML comments can be seen by the end user. Comments left behind by developers could include information that helps attackers.
Salesforce doesn't display normal comments, but conditional comments are visible. See HTML Comments and IE Conditional Comments
• OWASP Top 10 2017 Category A3 - Sensitive Data Exposure
This is a header comment and can be ignored.
vf:ImgWithoutAltCheck,"Images Tags Should Have an ""alt"" Attribute","
The alt attribute provides a textual alternative to an image.
It is used whenever the actual image cannot be rendered.
• The image can no longer be found
• Slow internet connections, while waiting for the image to download
• Visually impaired users using a screen reader software
• Images loading is disabled, e.g. to reduce data consumption on mobile phones

column2: img src=""foo.png"" alt=""Some textual description of foo.png"" /&gt

column1: vf:InlineStyleCheck,Avoid Inline CSS Styles,"The goal of this rule is to ban the usage of HTML ""style"" property to make sure that all CSS styles are defined in CSS classes.

column3: tags can also be a weak point for HTML injection.
tags the CDATA (HTML 4) or raw text (HTML 5) context applies. In this mode, the parser

column1: searches for the closing script or style tag, and dispatches the contents of the string between these tags to the javascript or
CSS parser. No HTML decoding occurs. This is because the HTML parser does not understand javascript or CSS
limited to determining the length of the string to pass to the JS or CSS parser.""

column3: //Bad: using the inline style property is not recommended.

column1: Heading tags are used by search engines and screen reader softwares to construct an outline of the page.

column3: and not skipping any level eases this automatic construction.

column5: //Bad: h1 is not being used before h2.
//Good: h3 is being used after h2.

column1: vf:MaxLineLengthCheck,Avoid Long Lines,"Having to scroll horizontally makes it harder to get a quick overview and understanding of any piece of code.

column3: //Bad: The line below is much too long. Consider breaking it up over multiple lines.
This may be a description on a page, html text or an element with a lot of attributes but having to scroll to the right a long way to find out what is going on is the worst&lt

column1: vf:AvoidHardCodedPageLink,Avoid Hard-Coded Page Links.,"Avoid hard-coded Page links, use correct page references.
This is a link to another page.
This is a link to another page.
vf:LightningPageCheck,Check for Lightning Migration Issues for apex:page attributes,"This rule looks for apex:page attributes usage which may no longer work in lightning.

vf:InputImgWithoutWidthOrHeightCheck,"Image buttons should always have a ""width"" and a ""height"" attribute","If the width and height attributes are set, the space required for the image is reserved immediately by the browser, even before it actually starts to load the image.
Without those attributes, the page layout constantly changes as images are loaded until they are all loaded, which can disorient users.

column2: img src=""logo.png"" alt=""My Company"" width=""100"" height=""50"" /&gt

column1: vf:LightningIframeCheck,Check for Lightning Migration Issues for apex:iframe,"This rule looks for apex:iframe usage which may no longer work in lightning.
Although apex:iframe is supported in Lightning Experience, we recommend avoiding it.

Only use this component if you're comfortable working with iframes in JavaScript and understand how they affect the DOM. If you haven't worked with nested iframes before, you might run into problems that are difficult to debug.
